General Information on a Surviving Child Entitled to Survivors Pension in Their Own Right
A surviving child is entitled to Survivors Pension in their own right only if
the surviving child is not in the custody of the surviving spouse (as the term custody is defined in
38 CFR 3.57(d)
), or
there is no surviving spouse who is eligible for pension, for example, the surviving spouse is deceased or remarried.
Important
:  A surviving child is not eligible for Survivors Pension in their own right if in the custody of an unremarried surviving spouse whose income or net worth is excessive for pension purposes.
References
:  For more information on
a surviving child’s independent pension eligibility, see
38 CFR 3.24
, and
custody for current-law pension purposes, see
38 CFR 3.57(d)
.
